question: Will the price of a barrel of crude oil be $110 or more on June 3, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether the price of crude oil will be at $110.00 USD or higher as of market close on June 3, 2022. If value of a barrel of oil is $110.00 or greater as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “Yes”. If the value of a barrel of oil is less than $110.00 as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “No”.

The resolution source for this market will be Yahoo Finance’s reporting of the values offered by the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX), found at (https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CL%3DF/history). Resolution will be based on the value listed in the column labelled “Close*” under the resolution date. If the resolution source is deemed unreliable, other credible media sources may be used.

question: Will the Otherdeed floor price be above 3.5 ETH on June 6?
description:
Otherdeed is the NFT token representing virtual plots of land in Otherside, Bored Ape Yacht Club’s open metaverse RPG that is compatible with other popular NFTs, created by Yuga Labs. Read more about the project at its official website, https://otherside.xyz/.

This is a market on whether Otherdeed will maintain a floor price above 3.50 ETH on June 6, 2022 (at 12:00 PM ET), according to https://opensea.io/collection/otherdeed.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, on the aforementioned check time, there are no items from the Otherside collection listed for sale ("Buy now") for 3.50 ETH or lower on the official Otherside collection page on OpenSea. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date.

Note that the exact price at the check time will be used. If no floor price is available at the check time, the source will be checked every following hour. For valid listings that are declining price auctions, the price exactly at the check time will be used, NOT the price at the initial listing time.

question: NHL: Who will win Avalanche vs. Blues, scheduled for May 25, 8:10 PM ET?
description:
In the upcoming NHL game, scheduled for May 25, 8:10 PM ET:

If the Colorado Avalanche win, the market will resolve to “Avalanche”.

If the St Louis Blues win, the market will resolve to “Blues”.

If the game is not completed by June 1 (11:59:59 PM ET), the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Formula 1: Who will finish ahead at the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix, Max Verstappen or Charles Leclerc?
description:
This is a market on the higher placed finisher at the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix, Max Verstappen or Charles Leclerc. The race takes place over 78 laps of the 3.337-kilometre Circuit de Monaco in Monte Carlo on Sunday, May 29.

The market will resolve to “Max Verstappen” if Max Verstappen finishes ahead of Charles Leclerc, and “Charles Leclerc” if Charles Leclerc finishes ahead of Max Verstappen. 

Note:
- If Max Verstappen finishes the race but Charles Leclerc does not, or does not compete at all, the market will resolve to “Max Verstappen”. 
- If Charles Leclerc finishes the race but Max Verstappen does not, or does not compete at all, the market will resolve to “Charles Leclerc”. 
- If neither Charles Leclerc nor Max Verstappen finish the race before June 5 (11:59 PM ET), then the market will resolve to 50-50. 
- If for any reason the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date on or before June 5, 2022, the same market conditions will apply.

question: Formula 1: Will there be 2 or more safety cars at 2022 Monaco Grand Prix?
description:
A safety car in Formula 1 is a car which limits the speed of the cars on the track when the track is under caution conditions. If an accident or inclement weather (typically, heavy rain) prevents normal racing from continuing safely, the Race Director calls for a "safety car" period, which would see marshals wave yellow flags and hold "SC" boards, pending the car in question entering the track. 

This is a market on the number of safety car (SC) periods run at the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix, which takes place over 78 laps of the 3.337-kilometre Circuit de Monaco in Monte Carlo on Sunday, May 29.

The market will resolve to “Yes” if there are 2 or more safety car periods in the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix and "No" otherwise.

Note: 
- For the purposes of this market, only Safety Car periods (SC) are to be counted. A virtual safety car period will not count towards market resolution. If a virtual safety car period is upgraded to become a full safety car period, it may then be counted as 1 safety car period. 
- A red flag period will not count as a safety car period, but a safety car period running for 1 lap or more that becomes a red flag will count as 1 safety car period. 
- If the race begins under a safety car, usually done in case of rain causing a standing start to be deemed unsafe, this will count as a safety car, as long as 1 counted lap has taken place.
- If for any reason the 2022 Monaco Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date on or before June 5, 2022, the same market conditions will apply. 

The resolution source for this market will be the official F1 website: https://www.formula1.com/, particularly the race report and lap-by-lap links that will populate the website under https://www.formula1.com/en/racing/2022/Monaco.html

question: Will the floor price of Goblintowns be above 1 ETH on June 3?
description:
This is a market on whether NFT collection Goblintown.wtf will have a floor price above 1 ETH on June 3, 2022 (at 12:00 PM ET), according to https://opensea.io/collection/goblintownwtf.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, on the aforementioned check time, there are no Goblintowns listed for sale ("Buy now") for 1 ETH or less on the official Goblintown.wtf collection page on OpenSea. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date.

Note that the exact price at the check time will be used. If no floor price is available at the check time, the source will be checked every following hour. For valid listings that are declining price auctions, the price exactly at the check time will be used, NOT the price at the initial listing time.

question: Will Doodles or CloneX have higher floor price on June 10?
description:
This is a market on whether Doodles or Clonex will have a higher floor price in ETH on June 10, 2022, at 12 PM ET.

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on OpenSea (https://opensea.io/collection/doodles-official, https://opensea.io/collection/clonex), specifically the prices of the cheapest Doodle and the cheapest CloneX listed for sale ("Buy Now").

This market will resolve to "Doodles" if, at the resolution time, the floor price of Doodles is higher than the floor price of CloneX. This market will resolve to "CloneX" if, at the resolution time, the floor price of CloneX is higher than the floor price of Doodles. If the floor prices of both collections are equal, this market will resolve 50-50.

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date.

Note that the exact price at the check time will be used. If no floor price is available at the check time, the source will be checked every following hour. The last possible data check will be on June 17, 12 PM ET. If the resolution source is still unavailable by then, another credible source will be used. For valid listings which are declining price auctions, the price exactly at the check time will be used, NOT the price at the initial listing time.

question: Will daily volume on Opensea drop below $20M by June 15?
description:
This is a market on daily trade volume for the Opensea NFT marketplace according to DappRadar: https://dappradar.com/multichain/marketplaces/opensea. The "Volume" chart data under "Historical activity" will be used as this market's resolution source.

If for any day within this market's timeframe the resolution source reports a daily volume lower than $20.00M, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, when the daily data for every day within this market's timeframe are available, and on every day the volume is $20.00M or higher, this market will resolve to "No". 

If all of the relevant data are not available by June 22 (11 PM ET), and the "Yes" conditions have not been met, this market will resolve to "No".

Data checks performed on a relevant data point within this market’s timeframe must be conducted after that data point is finalized for the check to be valid to resolve this market.

This market's timeframe spans May 24 to June 15 (inclusive).
